title: Pontiac Correctional Center phone & email directory

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Pontiac Correctional Center:  

Telephone directory of all current Pontiac Correctional Center employees and staff.

Email directory of all current Pontiac Correctional Center employees and staff.

Comprehensive list of current phone numbers, extensions, and corresponding names. If possible, please include position titles of each extension.  For example, extension 6226 is Family Liaisons (position title) and directs the caller to Natalie Mason (name).

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

From the AMERITHRAX investigation: Provide a digital copy of the recording of the full conversation between Dr. Bruce Ivins and his friend called "my secret sharer." According to an article "What Happened to Dr. Bruce Ivins? Netflix's 'Anthrax Attacks' Doc Revisits the Anthrax Letters Case," by Anna Menta, in the Decider, Sep 8, 2022:  "They also got him to admit to a friend, who was secretly wearing a wire, that he had blackout bouts of depression and rage, in which he didn't remember what he did. When she asked if he sent the anthrax letters, he replied "I can't recall doing anything like that."  According to the documentary, this conversation took place on 5 June 2008.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sherman McCall
